text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zambian press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The Ndola High Court has authorised the inspection of former president Kenneth Kaunda's citizenship files by petitioners questioning his nationality.
- The opposition Zambia Democratic Congress has dismissed calls for inter-party dialogue and called on Zambians to resort to 'any means' to unseat the government.
- The government has appointed a team to investigate irregular dealings at the state-run Zambia Telephone Company (Zamtel).
- The Drug Enforcement Commission has arrested four foreigners holding forged Zambian passports and 2.77 kg of cocaine.
- The Norwegian Pollution Control Authority has signed an agreEment for institutional support to the Environmental Council of Zambia.
- Three journalists facing criminal charges under the State Security Act were acquitted by the High Court.
- The Zambia Export Growers Association says only horticultural farmers with experience in exports will benefit from European Union and European Investment Bank funding.
